page.title: Until the End of Time (Justin Timberlake and Beyoncé song)

revision.text:
{{Infobox song | name = Until the End of Time | cover = JT Until the End of Time.png | alt = | border = yes | type = single | artist = [[Justin Timberlake]] | album = [[FutureSex/LoveSounds]] | A-side = [[Summer Love (Justin Timberlake song)|Summer Love]] | B-side = [[LoveStoned|LoveStoned/I Think She Knows]] | released = {{start date|2007|11|13}} | format = {{hlist|[[12-inch single|12"]]|[[CD single|CD]]|[[Music download|digital download]]}} | recorded = 2006 | studio =[[Thomas Crown Studios]]{{!}}{{small|([[Virginia Beach, Virginia]])}} | venue = | genre = {{hlist|[[Soul music|Soul]]|[[R&B]]{{cite journal|last=Caramanica|first=Jon|title=Justin Timberlake: FutureSex/LoveSounds|journal=Vibe|date=October 2006|volume=14|page=142|issn=1070-4701|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=8iYEAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA142|accessdate=September 11, 2011}}}} | length = {{Duration|m=5|s=22}} | label = {{hlist|[[Jive Records|Jive]]|[[Zomba Group of Companies|Zomba]]}} | writer = {{hlist|[[Justin Timberlake]]|[[Timbaland]]|[[Danja (producer)|Nate "Danja" Hills]]}} | producer = {{hlist|Timbaland|Timberlake|Danja}} | chronology = [[Justin Timberlake]] | prev_title = [[The Only Promise That Remains]] | prev_year = 2007 | next_title = [[Summer Love (Justin Timberlake song)|Summer Love]] | next_year = 2007 | misc = {{Extra chronology | artist = [[Beyoncé]] | type = singles | prev_title = [[Green Light (Beyoncé song)|Green Light]] | prev_year = 2007 | title = Until the End of Time | year = 2007 | next_title = [[Love in This Club Part II]] | next_year = 2008 }} }} "'''Until the End of Time'''" is a song recorded by American singer-songwriter [[Justin Timberlake]] from his second studio album, ''[[FutureSex/LoveSounds]]'' (2006), written and produced by Timberlake, [[Timbaland]], and [[Danja (producer)|Nate "Danja" Hills]]. The song was later re-recorded as a duet featuring American singer [[Beyoncé]], which was released as a single on November 13, 2007 and included on the Deluxe Edition of the album.{{Cite web |url=http://www.deezer.com/album/1206319|title=Until The End Of Time - Duet with Beyonce|website=Deezer}}{{Cite news |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1575000/justin-timberlake-looks-back-to-the-future-plus-pitbull-common-keane-and-more-in-new-releases/ |title=Justin Timberlake Looks Back to the Future |date=November 26, 2007 |work=MTV News |access-date=June 17, 2017}} It reached the top 20 on the US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]], being the sixth single from the album to do so, with Timberlake becoming the only male artist in the decade to achieve this.{{Cite news |url=http://www.digitalspy.com/music/news/a77555/justin-timberlake-makes-us-chart-history/ |title=Justin Timberlake makes US chart history |date=October 12, 2007 |work=Digital Spy |access-date=June 18, 2017 |language=en}} During the concert tour [[FutureSex/LoveShow]], Timberlake performed the song as a [[piano]] solo.{{Cite news |url=http://www.adelaidenow.com.au/entertainment/sexy-sure-is-back/news-story/fa4f5506b296df8661b119335c33a916 |title=Sexy sure is back |date=November 2, 2007 |work=The Advertiser |access-date=June 18, 2017}} ==Composition== "Until the End of Time" is a [[quiet storm]] ballad, [[R&B]] [[slow jam]].{{Cite news |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/songreviews/until-the-end-of-time-20071115 |title=Justin Timberlake and Beyoncé: "Until the End of Time" |date=November 15, 2007 |work=Rolling Stone |access-date=June 17, 2017}}{{Cite news |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/justin-timberlake-revs-up-his-sex-machine-20060921 |title=Justin Timberlake Revs Up His Sex Machine |date=September 21, 2006 |work=Rolling Stone |access-date=June 17, 2017}} The song utilizes [[Linn LM-1|Linn drums]], which Ben Williams of ''[[New York (magazine)|New York]]'' compared to Prince's "[[The Beautiful Ones]]".{{cite news |url=http://nymag.com/arts/popmusic/reviews/20314/ |title=The Men Who Would Be Prince |first=Ben |last=Williams |work=[[New York (magazine)|New York]] |publisher=New York Media |date=September 11, 2006 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/64vKUElfX?url=http://nymag.com/arts/popmusic/reviews/20314/ |archivedate=January 24, 2012 |access-date=May 17, 2009 |url-status=live |df=mdy-all }} ==Critical reception== In his review for ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'', Michael Slezak opined the single "sounds like another smash. The original flavor was already a treat —a stripped-down slow jam with a gorgeously simple melody."{{Cite news |url=http://ew.com/article/2007/09/28/beyonce-justin/ |title=Snap judgment: Justin Timberlake and Beyoncé's new duet |date=September 28, 2007 |work=EW.com |access-date=June 17, 2017 |language=en-US}} For ''[[Complex (magazine)|Complex]]'', Tannis Spencer wrote, "Justin and Beyonce got nice and comfy on this ballad and complement each from start to finish. The beat is slow with an accompanying string section that serves as the perfect backdrop for when Justin hits his high notes. The record has a sultry sound which helps offset the super futuristic sound on the rest of the album."{{Cite news |url=http://www.complex.com/music/2013/03/the-25-best-justin-timberlake-songs/justin-timberlake-until-the-end-of-time |title=The 25 Best Justin Timberlake Songs |date=March 15, 2013 |work=Complex |access-date=June 17, 2017 |language=en}} ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' editor Adelle Platon described it as a "dreamy [[love song]]."{{Cite news |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/hip-hop/7633393/justin-timberlake-best-hip-hop-rb-collaborations |title=Justin Timberlake's 14 Best Hip-Hop/R&B Collaborations |last=Platon |first=Adelle |date=December 27, 2016 |work=Billboard |access-date=June 18, 2017}} Quentin B. Huff of [[PopMatters]] wrote that "Until the End of Time" is heavily reminiscent of [[Prince (musician)|Prince]]'s work, adding "both songs (with "Sexy Ladies") are album highlights, but they don't seem to strive for the same level of innovation as other songs in the set."{{cite magazine |url=http://www.popmatters.com/pm/review/justin-timberlake-futuresex-lovesounds/ |title=Justin Timberlake: FutureSex/LoveSounds |first=Quentin B. |last=Huff |magazine=[[PopMatters]] |date=October 5, 2006 |accessdate=January 24, 2012}} [[Sputnikmusic]]'s Amanda Murray called the song "excessively bland."{{cite web |url=http://sputnikmusic.com/review/9197/Justin-Timberlake-FutureSex-LoveSounds/ |title=Justin Timberlake FutureSex/LoveSounds |website=[[Sputnikmusic]] |first=Amanda |last=Murray |date=September 17, 2006 |accessdate=January 25, 2012}} ==Chart performance== In the United States, the solo version of "Until the End of Time" entered the top 40 on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100 for the chart issued October 20, 2007, making him the first solo male artist that decade to spawn six top 40 singles from the same album. The previous male soloist to achieve that feat was [[Michael Jackson]] with ''[[Dangerous (Michael Jackson album)|Dangerous]]'', which generated seven top 40 Hot 100 entries during 1991-1993. The previous album overall to do so was [[Shania Twain]]'s ''[[Come On Over (Shania Twain album)|Come On Over]]'', which had six top 40 singles during 1997-1999. The same week, the song entered the top five on the [[Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs]] chart.{{Cite news |url=http://www.billboard.com/biz/articles/news/1318258/timberlake-hits-big-with-until-the-end-of-time |title=Timberlake Hits Big With 'Until the End of Time' |last=October 10, 2007 |work=Billboard |access-date=June 17, 2017 |language=en}} Eventually, the duet version became Timberlake's 17th and Beyoncé's 21st career top 20 song on the Hot 100. The song also became the sixth US top 20 entry from the album and Timberlake became the first to do that since Michael Jackson in 1991. It also became [[Beyoncé]]'s highest charting single on US Adult R&B radio peaking at number 2, until "[[Love On Top]]" in 2012.{{Cite news |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/the-juice/504456/chart-juice-beyonce-banks-first-adult-rb-no-1#/column/the-juice/chart-juice-beyonce-banks-first-adult-r-1006269962.story |title=Chart Juice: Beyonce Banks First Adult R&B No. 1 |date=February 23, 2012 |work=Billboard |access-date=June 18, 2017}} ==Formats and track listings== {{Wikipedia books|FutureSex/LoveSounds}} ;Digital download (3-track){{cite web |url=https://itunes.apple.com/at/album/until-end-time-duet-with-beyonce/id269289530 |language=German |title=Until the End of Time – Duet With Beyonce – Single |publisher=iTunes Store (Apple Inc.) |accessdate=January 23, 2012}} # "Until the End of Time" – 5:22 # "[[Summer Love (Justin Timberlake song)|Summer Love]]" (Main Version – Clean) – 4:12 # "[[LoveStoned|LoveStoned/I Think She Knows]]" (Justice Remix) – 4:43 ;Remixes EP{{cite web |url=https://itunes.apple.com/at/album/until-the-end-of-time-ep/id272818727 |title=Until the End of Time – EP |language=German |publisher=iTunes Store (Apple Inc.) |accessdate=January 23, 2011}} # "Until the End of Time" ([[Jason Nevins]] Extended Mix) – 7:20 # "Until the End of Time" (Jason Nevins Mixshow) – 5:42 # "Until the End of Time" ([[Ralphi Rosario]] BIG Radio Mix) – 3:53 # "Until the End of Time" ([[Johnny Vicious]] and DJ Escape Remix) – 8:35 # "Until the End of Time" ([[Mike Rizzo]] Global Club Mix) – 7:30 # "Until the End of Time" ([[Jonathan Peters]] Club Mix) – 8:50 ==Credits and personnel== Credits adapted from ''FutureSex/LoveSounds'' booklet:{{cite AV media notes |title=FutureSex/LoveSounds |titlelink=FutureSex/LoveSounds |year=2006 |others=Justin Timberlake |authorlink=Justin Timberlake|type=Compact Disc |chapter=Liner notes |publisher=Jive, Zomba |page=20 |id=8 28768 80622 7|location=Virginia Beach, Virginia}} {{col-begin}} {{col-2}} *[[Jimmy Douglass]] – [[Mix engineer|mixer]], [[Sound recording and reproduction|recorder]] *Kaliq Glover – [[Strings (music)|strings recorder]] *[[Dave Hampton]] – technical director *Lisa Hampton – [[Pro Tools]] engineer *[[Danja (musician)|Danja]] – drums, [[Key (engineering)|keys]] producer, writer *Beyoncé – additional vocals *[[Timbaland]] – drums, keys, producer, recorder, writer *Justin Timberlake – background vocals, producer, writer *Ethan Willoughby – additional Pro Tools engineer *[[Benjamin Wright (composer)|Benjamin Wright]] – conductor, [[String section|strings arrangement]] *The Benjamin Wright Orchestra: **Richard Adkins – violin **Peggy Baldwin – [[viola]] **Brian Benning – violin **[[Charlie Bisharat]] – violin **Ida Bodin – bass **Kevin Brandon – bass **Mark Cargill – [[concertmaster]], contractor, violin **Susan Chatman – violin {{col-2}} **Phillippa "Pip" Clarke – violin **[[Jeff Clayton]] – [[flute]] **Salvator Cracchiolo – trumpet **[[Yvette Devereaux]] – violin **Ernie Ehrhardt – viola **James Ford – trumpet **Pam Gates – violin **Songa Lee-Kitto – violin **Valerie King – flute **Marisa McLeod – violin **Giovana Moraga – viola **Partick Morgan – viola **Michele Nardonecelli – viola **Cameron Patrick – viola **Kathleen Robertson – violin **Jimbo Ross – viola **Nancy Stein-Ross – viola **Mari Tsumura – violin {{col-end}} ==Charts== ===Weekly charts=== {{col-begin}} {{col-2}} {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- ! Chart (2007–08) ! Peak

scope="col"|Charts (2000–09) ! scope="col"|Position |- !scope="row"|US Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/charts-decade-end/r-b-hip-hop-songs?year=2009&begin=11&order=position |title=Top Hip-Hop and R&B Songs & Singles Charts |work=Billboard |publisher=Prometheus Global Media |accessdate=December 15, 2010}} | style="text-align:center;"|20 |- !scope="row"|US Mainstream R&B/Hip-Hop Songs{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.biz/bbbiz/charts/decadeendcharts/2009/mainstream-r-and-and-b-hip-hop-songs |title=DECADE END CHARTS Mainstream R&B/Hip-Hop Songs |work=Billboard |publisher=Prometheus Global Media |accessdate=December 15, 2010}} | style="text-align:center;"|46 |} {{col-end}} ==Certifications== {{certification Table Top}} {{certification Table Entry|type=single|region=United States|artist=Justin Timberlake|title=Until the End of Time|award=Gold |salesamount=500,000}} {{Certification Table Bottom}} == Release history == {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" ! Amazon Inc|accessdate=May 29, 2012}} |- ! scope="row" rowspan="2"| Singapore | rowspan="2"| December 24, 2007 | Digital download (Remixes, version 1) | {{cite web|url=http://sg.7digital.com/artist/justin-timberlake/release/until-the-end-of-time-8|title=Until The End Of Time|work=7digital}} |- | Digital download (Remixes, version 2) | {{cite web|url=http://sg.7digital.com/artist/justin-timberlake/release/until-the-end-of-time-11|title=Until The End Of Time|work=7digital}} |- ! scope="row"| Sweden | December 10, 2007 | Digital download (EP) | http://se.7digital.com/artist/justin-timberlake/release/until-the-end-of-time-duet-with-beyonce |- |} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== * {{MetroLyrics song|justin-timberlake|until-the-end-of-time}} {{Justin Timberlake songs}} {{Beyoncé songs}} [[Category:2000s ballads]] [[Category:2006 songs]] [[Category:2007 singles]] [[Category:Beyoncé songs]] [[Category:Justin Timberlake songs]] [[Category:Male–female vocal duets]] [[Category:Pop ballads]] [[Category:Song recordings produced by Danja (record producer)]] [[Category:Song recordings produced by Timbaland]] [[Category:Song recordings produced by Justin Timberlake]] [[Category:Music videos directed by Marty Callner]] [[Category:Songs written by Justin Timberlake]] [[Category:Songs written by Timbaland]] [[Category:Songs written by Danja (record producer)]] [[Category:Jive Records singles]] [[Category:Quiet storm songs]] [[Category:Contemporary R&B ballads]] [[de:Until the End of Time]] [[pt:Until the End of Time]] [[ru:Until the End of Time (сингл)]]
